# Flow

[@steveruizok](http://twitter.com/steveruizok)

Stacked navigation flow for Framer X. Navigate from code, navigate from targets, keep fixed elements and more.

# Changelog

27/6
Rewrites how pages are shown. In previous versions the component would unmount components that donâ€™t need to be shown, keeping track of only the current and previous page. In this version, all pages in the stack are kept until removed from the stack.

For example, if we navigate to PageA, PageB, and then PageC, all three pages will remain mounted. If we show previous, our position will move to PageB but PageC will remain mounted. If we then navigate from PageB to PageA, PageC will be unmounted and weâ€™ll mount a second (but separate) PageA. 

This is useful for cases where pages have content (such as form fields, scroll positions, or interaction states) that need to be maintained. Traveling â€œbackâ€ to a previously visited screen will restore that screen exactly as the user had left it. 

This is also useful for navigation flows that load different versions of the same page, such as articles with different content but the same â€œpageâ€. (More on this in future updates).
